intro.speaker: Abel
intro.line: Yes, sire. Princess Elice bade us protect you. Sir Malledus stayed behind to accompany her.

intro.speaker: Frey
intro.line: Sire, we must be quick. Sir Jagen awaits us at the gates.

intro.speaker: Abel
intro.line: Blast! This will not do. How did Gra's soldiers ever make it this far?

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: Jagen and the others will be caught like mice...We need to seize the gates and secure the area, immediately.

battle.speaker: Enemy Soldier
battle.line: Now who's that who thinks they can sneak up on us? Ho ho... What's this? I spy the Altean prince. Oi, listen up, you lot! Bag the prince! Dead or alive, he'll fetch us as sweet a reward as the mind can conjure.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Hmm, they have archers... We need to take care they don't pick us off from afar.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Sire, it gladdens me to see you in one piece. It's not safe for you here; we must be away at once!

end.speaker: Cain
end.line: Prince Marth! Where are you? Answer me, sire!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Cain, you're supposed to be in Gra! Why have you returned without- Yow! Those wounds...!

end.speaker: Cain
end.line: Sire, it's really you...I feared the worst. That his message would go undeliv...Agh...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: In that state, I don't know how you even stayed ahorse. Those gashes must be treated at once-

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: No, sire. Not until we've escaped.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: ...Cain, I trust you can put off bleeding to death for just a while longer?

end.speaker: Cain
end.line: Of course, sir... I aim to please...

end.speaker: Malledus
end.line: Princess Elice! The enemy is nearly upon us! Gather your things, quickly!

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: No, Malledus. I am staying here.

end.speaker: Malledus
end.line: S-staying here?! What madness is this?

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: Too many people have died to keep Altea and its castle safe. I cannot abandon what so many lives have brought. With Father and Mother unaccounted for, I am the natural choice to remain with Altea's people. And besides, by staying, I can buy time for the rest of you to escape.

end.speaker: Malledus
end.line: Nonsense. Just gather your things, and-

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: Malledus. I am not suggesting. I am commanding. If something befalls Father, Marth will become the last person in the entire world worthy of wielding the Falchion. I want you to guide him, Malledus- even when the rest of us no longer can.

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: There's not much time. Go, Malledus. ...Go!
